content:
Before you start you need to identify the type of file you have attached. It is not "scanned document" Brother, the maker of my printer offer a number of choices. See https://support.brother.com/g/b/faqend.aspx?c=us_ot&lang=en&prod=mfc8952dw_us&faqid=faq00000046_004

Once you have identified the type of file you can move on to what application opens that type of file. Noting here that the file extension has application to file types only in Windows, not in other operating systems and not in internet documents of which email is one, web pages are another. Hence my comments about some cheap printers below.

Note that many cheap printers have no idea how to attached a document to an email correctly and attach them as text or some for of format flowed binary. Thunderbird will not be able to open them successfully because they are not correctly described. But lets first work out what file format they think they are using.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Are both computers using Linux OS ?

Did you install Thunderbird from the official website?

  • https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

Or did you get Thunderbird from Snap or Flatpak ?

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-thunderbird-linux

I ask the above because that determines where the '.thunderbird' folder is located. The '.thunderbird' folder contains everything - so that is the folder to copy.

If downloaded from website then it should be here:

  • /home/user/.thunderbird

I think Flatpak puts it here:

  • /home/username/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird

Snap could be here :

  • /home/username/snap/thunderbird/common/.thunderbird

Remember - Thunderbird must not be running whilst doing any copy and pasting on either computer. To get everything - profile, preferences, accounts, mail, address books, calendars etc etc, you need to copy the '.thunderbird' folder Where it is located depends upon method you used to install Thunderbird.

When you want to paste it into new computer - install Thunderbird first and then locate the new default created '.thunderbird' folder and delete it. Then paste in the copied '.thunderbird' folder into same location thus replacing the one you deleted.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
rer :The server responded: Try again later, closing connection..

That is a specific message from the server not Thunderbird. It sounds like the server is having a problem. Maybe the server is undergoing maintenance or suffering from high traffic.

But as you have not provided any information about your set up nor what server you are trying to access. You could check to see if the server is down right now or see if the website of company that provides server has any info on known issues.

In the meantime I suggest you check the following on your computer: Firewall: The Firewall may be controlled by the default one that came with the OS or it might be controlled by an Anti-Virus you installed. Access the Firewall and set up the Thunderbird program as 'allowed'. It's important to have Thunderbird set up as an allowed program to ensure nothing ever gets blocked. Confirm: Thunderbird is set up as allowed program in Firewall.

VPN Please check your computer for any VPN. Some OS now include a VPN and many Anti-Virus products now offer a VPN. I have come across people who discovered they had a VPN that was enabled which they did not realise. So please double check computer - if you have a VPN enabled then switch it off because srevers do not like VPN as it hides your IP address so they think a hacker is trying to to access your account and so they block access. If you insist on using a VPN then you must set up a split tunneling and set up Thunderbird to use it.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :now only shows emails that have been starred

Please check to see if you have a filter in operation. 'Quick Filter' - it has an icon which can filter on 'starred' email, so only displaying anything starred. Is that option selected? - it would have a thin blue line on the icon - if yes, click on it to disable.

Or maybe the 'pin' icon is selected meaning it's applying a filter set previously on maybe another folder.

content:
There are various Help Articles. This one covers the basics, so you can understand naming conventions. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova

There are two layouts for seeing the list of Messages and you can choose which one you prefer. By default, I think Thunderbird starts with 'Card View' but there is also a Table View. Click on the icon to the right of 'Quick Filter' - see image below as a guide.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Account Settings > Junk Settings for the account

Select checkbox 'enable adaptive junk mail controls for this account' Select all the address books that you want to be considered as a whitelist - basically email addresses in the selected address books are good.

Advise you do not select to trust junkmail headers.

Destination & Retention

  • Select 'Move new junk messages to'

IF using POP account:

  • Select 'Junk folder on' and name of account.

IF using an IMAP account:

  • Select 'Other' and choose the correct Spam on account

Now you need to train the adaptive filter and that means selecting both what is junk and what is 'not junk'. Any message in Inbox which is Junk/Spam click on the 'Spam' button OR use right click on email in list and select 'Mark as' > 'Spam' Anything that goes to Spam and is not junk/spam - click on the 'Not Spam' button or use the rigth click on email in list and select 'Mark as 'Not Spam'

After about a week things start to improve as the filter learns what is and what is not Spam. Please note, anything put into the Spam folder by the server is not undre the control of Thunderbird.

How to know if server put email in Spam. If Thunderbird put email in Spam then it will display a red/orange flame icon. If flame icon is grey then server put it in Spam.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Ok, the monthly release, what is it 145 or the like, uses spam for everything. The ESR release uses the term junk. Fundamentally Thunderbird is having a schizophrenic situation with regard to junk/spam and we may well see the return of a junk folder when the dust settles. At the moment it is basically a well intentioned mess. with a load of bug being reported from broken localizations etc and the wholesale replacement of folder names in the folder pane, but not in reality. Only what is seen has changed which makes for some interesting dichotomies. I have two spam folders in some accounts. Thank you guys, it was not broken until you fixed it.

Below are the account settings for the same email account from the current ESR build using the term Junk and the other if from a daily developer build with the newer term SPAM. Same ting, new label.

greg said
Right now, for instance, the only thing that the option to press to make it junk is one that I have been trying to make junk for a long time.

Do you mean this setting in account settings is grayed out?

There are a number of junk setting in the general setting as shown below.

But this is all covered in the user support document. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages

content:
All mail account passwords can only be created or reset when you are logged onto the webmail account for the email address via a browser.

If you cannot remember the password, then you should find the website login page will provide a 'forgotten password' link. You need to use it and follow instructions in order to regain access to your webmail account.

However, you have not stated why you need to know a password. Usually, mail accounts are created and the password is stored so Thunderbird can keep using it in the background to access the server. Stored passwords are visible here:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Under 'Passwords' section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'show Passwords'

If asked for a 'Windows security password' at this point then you enter the same password you use when you start up computer and need to logon to your User Account to see the desktop.

Did you try to send an email and got an error message? If yes, what did it say - word for word verbatim.

Is this a Pop account or an IMAP account? What version of Thunderbird are you using ? What server are you trying to access ? What comes after the @ in the email address, then maybe we can work out what server you should be using. Some servers need you to set up an app specific password, so we need to know what server so we can advise you further.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
As a heads up when ever you have a problem or question, please include information to help people understand your setup and issue. Such as the OS you are using as this effects what instructions need to be given. what version of Thunderbird you are using or want to install If issue is about mail accounts, then provide info on what server you are trying to use and whether the account is a Pop or Imap acount etc. If you ever get an error message then post an image of the error.


If you have a MAC which can only use version 115.18.0 Then you can get it via this link:

  • https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.18.0/
  • If using a mac then select the 'mac/' option
  • Next select prefered language eg: en-GB is English British
  • Finally click on the link 'Thunderbird 115.18.0.dmg ' to download to computer.

System REquirements and Release notes to use 115* https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.18.0esr/releasenotes/ https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0/system-requirements/
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder, close TB, copy mbox files into the Mail/Local Folders location, renaming the mbox files if necessary. Restart TB and find folders under Local Folders in the Folder Pane named after the mbox files. If you delete messages, the underlying mbox will be modified.

There is an add-on, ImportExportTools NG, that performs this and more involved operations, but it isn't necessary for the simple steps above.

You might have to add at least one mail account before Local Folders is created.
